item.title: Extremely overgrown, 19th July
item.description:
You reported back that this had been fixed and closed the case - nothing has been done or touched - it is a disgrace - it is bad enough we have a boarded up run down pub without the disgusting rubbish and overgrown weeds everywhere - where does our council tax go?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Wickham Lane, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 19th July
item.description:
This is outside 46 High Street Bexley, the design in the road is continuously flooding. water comes over the pavement and into the shop acrosd the threshold at Mane 44 High Street. causing a slip hazard to the general public and shop customers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59, Bexley High Street, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please can you clear these weeds and plants from this public area., 19th July
item.description:
The plants are out of control and have not been tended to. As a result they could cause damage to my fence (number 49 Foyle Road). I have removed them from my fence for that reason. Brambles and plants at the rear of the neighbouring property (47) are also out of control. The thorns cause danger to young children and the high level of undergrowth has resulted in vermin. Thank you very much.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Webb Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not emptied! So not “fixed”, 19th July
item.description:
Reported this the other day. It’s reported as fixed this morning. I’ve just looked and it’s exactly as it was when I reported. Can we please stop the lies and just empty the bin??!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cronin Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: College Road SE19 re 1 – 11 Princess Court. Pri, 19th July
item.description:
College Road SE19 re 1 – 11 Princess Court. Princess Court is a Southwark Housing building I believe so please pass on if needed. Next to College Road footpath re pedestrian access to this property is wooden hand rail which has been graffiti tagged. Google Streetview shows this: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4248703,-0.0760661,3a,75y,266.28h,73.73t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sXdl4TCUS_K-ha1PqO7S2Bw!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D16.266638325609335%26panoid%3DXdl4TCUS_K-ha1PqO7S2Bw%26yaw%3D266.27762142521686!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDcxNi4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
